agency_desc: A commercial organization with treatment centers throughout Indiana that provides a 28-day inpatient residential detox and addiction treatment for alcohol and substances, including heroin, methamphetamine, cocaine, and prescription pills. A virtual intensive outpatient program is available for those not needing residential treatment.
service_description: Provides a 28-day inpatient residential detox and addiction treatment for alcohol and substances, including heroin, methamphetamine, cocaine, and prescription pills. Co-occurring disorders such as depression, anxiety, PTSD, and trauma are also treated.
taxonomy_name: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
Residential Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
Residential Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
site_details: Self-referring: Call for information or to schedule intake. -- Medical/Mental health provider referring: Call, email or fax referral and supporting documentation.

site_schedule.name: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
Residential Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities

site_eligibility: Men -- Age 18 or older -- In need of inpatient alcohol and/or substance use detox or treatment -- Medically stable -- Able to complete activities of daily living (showering, dressing, feeding etc.) -- Able and willing to participate in mandatory programming from day one

agency_desc: Provides electric service for customers in portions of Harrison County and portions of Clark, Crawford, Floyd, and Washington County.
service_description: Provides electric service to customers in portions of Harrison County and portions of Clark, Crawford, Floyd, and Washington County.
site_details: Call for assistance; bill can be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is available at this location.

site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 7:30-4:30 --  Outage Reporting: Daily 24 hours

site_eligibility: Addresses within set boundaries in Clark, Crawford, Floyd, Harrison, and Washington counties.

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call for information
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides access to a wide range of education and training opportunities.
service_description: Offers adult education classes designed to prepare student for the High School Equivalency Test or help graduates to improve basic skills in preparation for college or career advancement. Program service is provided by River Valley Resources.
site_details: Call for information. -- Students 16 or 17 must have exit interview signed by a principle to start class.
site_eligibility: Age 16 or older -- Not enrolled in high school (documentation required for age 16-17 years-old)
Open

Does not hold a diploma from an accredited high school or its equivalent -- Is a resident of the state of Indiana for a minimum of 30 days -- Either has officially exited high school or is at least 18 years-old -- Age 16 or older -- Age 18 or younger must complete an exit interview signed by a principal and have an Indiana Superintendent's recommendation

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides services to those who have been victims of crime.
service_description: Provides advocacy services for victims of any crime. Gives victims the opportunity to complete a Victim Impact Statement to submit to prosecutors prior to sentencing or plea negotiations. Additional assistance provided to victims in the filing of protective orders, court accompaniment, crisis intervention, case management, protective order assistance, and mobile advocacy. Special emphasis placed on victims of domestic violence and/or sexual assault. Services may include safety planning and help applying for victims compensation benefits.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility:
○Living in Harrison County 
○Victims of any crime

agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area 14) organization that provides information, referral, and other services to seniors and those with disabilities.
site_name: LIFESPAN RESOURCES AT JOE RHOADS SENIOR CENTER
service_description: Provides a hot, sit-down lunch and fellowship every weekday for area seniors. Meal includes entree, vegetables, low sugar desserts, whole grain breads, and beverages. Reservations required at least 24 hours in advance.
site_details: First visit: Registration required (free) -- Call one week in advance to make a reservation. -- Visit website, https://www.lsr14.org/congregate-centers, for monthly lunch menu.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older -OR- Individuals with disabilities

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing comprehensive behavioral health, addiction, and related services.
service_description: Provides comprehensive services to adults with mental health issues. Assessments may be done to determine treatment options including individual counseling, group therapy, case management, or psychiatric services.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Harrison County -- Ages 18 or older
Living in Harrison County -- Youth ages 5-17

agency_desc: Enforces animal-related ordinance, responds to animal-related emergencies, impounds stray domestic animals, and accepts surrendered animals from the public. Provides lost-and-found services, microchipping of pets, humane euthanasia for terminally ill pets, and adoption for homeless dogs and cats. Issues pet licenses in the Harrison County.
service_description: Provides domestic animal rescue and pet adoption/surrender services in Harrison County. Also offers Spay/Neuter voucher service to be used to reduce cost of services at participating veterinarian of choice.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open

service_description: Provides food to those in need.

service_description: Offers outpatient and intensive outpatient programs for adult struggling with drug or alcohol dependency. Programs last 16-weeks and involve education, groups, 12-step meetings, and other types of therapy.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides outreach services to those in need in Southern Indiana.

service_description: Provides limited financial assistance for rent and utilities to those in need. Rent must be past due and utilities be in disconnect status. Clothing vouchers may be provided to local Salvation Army thrift store.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that conducts forensic interviews of child victims of sexual abuse and provides services to families affected by sexual abuse.
service_description: Provides a prevention program for children in pre-K through 6th grade. The goal of the program is to give children the skills and language necessary to help adults protect them from abuse.

site_details: Call or visit website for information
site_eligibility: Classes/trainings are available for varying ages/abilities; call for specific information or visit website

agency_desc: Maintains land records for Harrison County, Indiana.
service_description: Provides the following county services: maintains section corners; files legal surveys; maintains voter precinct maps, annexation, and de-annexation; investigates drainage obstructions; and researches and documents all cemeteries in Harrison County.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Bodies

agency_desc: A government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in the County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in the County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information
site_eligibility: Harrison County residents

agency_desc: Maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in this county.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases in Harrison County. The clerk's office also issues marriage licenses; files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, custody/visitation, expungement, and protective orders; processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, traffic tickets, and other judgments; issues arrest warrants; and oversees all elections in the county.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Call for more information

Parents ordered by the county court to pay or receive child support

To apply for a marriage license, both persons must provide ONE of the following: Valid driver’s license with correct address -- Current state-issued ID card -- Birth certificate -- Passport -- Military ID -- For certified copies of a marriage license: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Harrison County.
service_description: Responsible for strategic planning and organizational management of natural and man made disasters  occurring in Harrison County.

agency_desc: County government organization responsible for land use planning.
service_description: Processes change of zone applications, subdivision applications, and variance and special exception requests. Also issues improvement location permits (building permits), certificates of occupancy, and addresses and sign permits. In addition, orders building inspections.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Bodies
Land Use Planning and Regulation Services

agency_desc: Represents the State of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Harrison County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.

agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals, including a resale store.
service_description: Builds affordable homes for low-income persons, using primarily volunteer labor. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through an affordable loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Call to request an application.
site_eligibility: Lived in the county for at least 1 full year -- Must meet income guidelines up to 150% of federal poverty guidelines (call or visit the website for current amounts.) -- Stable employment or other source of income for at least one year -- Willing to complete 18 hours of Home Ownership counseling and budget assistance classes in a group setting. -- Willingness to complete up to 400 hours of "sweat equity"

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Provides advocacy, information, referrals, and support services to crime victims and witnesses in Harrison County. Assists in the filing of restraining or protective orders, offers court accompaniment services, and provides information about case status, victim compensation, victim rights, and the legal process.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Victims and witnesses of major crimes in Harrison County

To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Harrison County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child
Varies by service

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for their respective county, including performing the following duties: controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handles appeal of township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.

site_schedule.name: General Relief Appeals/Complaints
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st Mon 8:30am and 3rd Mon 7pm

site_schedule.name: Local Officials Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st Mon 8:30am and 3rd Mon 7pm

site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
site_name: INDIANA STATE COURTS - HARRISON COUNTY SUPERIOR COURT
service_description: Provides probation services for the Harrison County Circuit Court, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for information.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Harrison Courts
Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
site_name: INDIANA STATE COURTS - HARRISON COUNTY CIRCUIT COURT
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in Harrison County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor’s office, private attorneys, or individuals representing themselves. For juror information, contact county clerk.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court
